hc.server.ui

Class Mlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • hc.server.ui.Mlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HTMLMlet

    public class Mlet
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Mlet is an instance running in HomeCenter server, and the snapshot of Mlet is presented on mobile. It looks more like a form, dialog, control panel or game canvas running in mobile.

    Mlet is extends JPanel, so you can bring all JPanel features to mobile UI, no matter whether your mobile is Android, iPhone or other.

    To present JComponents to mobile in HTML (not snapshot) and set CSS for these JComponents, please use HTMLMlet, which is extends Mlet.
    Since:
    7.0
    See Also:
    HTMLMlet, Serialized Form

      • getElementID

        public final java.lang.String getElementID()
        the elementID of current Mlet.

        for example, current Mlet is "form://MyMlet", then the elementID is "MyMlet".

        to get the instance of menu item for current Mlet in designer, invoke ProjectContext.getMenuItemBy(String, String).
        Returns:
        Since:

        See Also:

      • go

        public final void go(java.lang.String url)
        jump mobile to following targets:
        1. URL_SCREEN : enter the desktop screen of server from mobile,
        2. form://myMlet : open and show a form,
        3. controller://myctrl : open and show a controller,
        4. URL_EXIT : exit current Mlet, it is recommended to use back(),
        5. cmd://myCmd : run script commands only,

        bring to top :
        1. jump to form://B from form://A,
        2. ready jump to form://A again from form://B.
        3. system will bring the target (form://A) to top if it is opened.

        Note :
        go to external URL (for example, http://homecenter.mobi), invoke goExternalURL(String).
        Parameters:
        url -
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        go(String, String), goMlet(Mlet, String, boolean), setAutoReleaseAfterGo(boolean), goExternalURL(String, boolean)

      • go

        public final void go(java.lang.String scheme,
      java.lang.String elementID)
        go/run target URL by elementID.

        jump mobile to following targets:
        1. URL_SCREEN : enter the desktop screen of server from mobile,
        2. form://myMlet : open and show a form,
        3. controller://myctrl : open and show a controller,
        4. URL_EXIT : exit current Mlet,
        5. cmd://myCmd : run script commands only,

        bring to top :
        1. jump to form://B from form://A,
        2. ready jump to form://A again from form://B.
        3. system will bring the target (form://A) to top if it is opened.

        Note :
        go to external URL (for example, http://homecenter.mobi), invoke goExternalURL(String).
        Parameters:
        scheme - one of MenuItem.CMD_SCHEME, MenuItem.CONTROLLER_SCHEME, MenuItem.FORM_SCHEME or MenuItem.SCREEN_SCHEME.
        elementID - for example, run scripts of menu item "cmd://myCommand", the scheme is MenuItem.CMD_SCHEME, and element ID is "myCommand",
        See Also:
        go(String)

      • goExternalURL

        public final void goExternalURL(java.lang.String url)
        go to external URL in client application.

        Important :
        socket/connect permissions is required even if the domain of external URL is the same with the domain of upgrade HAR project URL.

        Warning :
        1. the external URL may be sniffed when in moving (exclude HTTPS).
        2. iOS 9 and above must use secure URLs.
        Parameters:
        url - for example : https://homecenter.mobi
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        goExternalURL(String, boolean)

      • goExternalURL

        public final void goExternalURL(java.lang.String url,
                 boolean isUseExtBrowser)
        deprecated, replaced by goExternalURL(String).

        go to external URL in system web browser or client application.

        Important :
        socket/connect permissions is required even if the domain of external URL is the same with the domain of upgrade HAR project URL.

        Warning :
        1. the external URL may be sniffed when in moving (exclude HTTPS).
        2. iOS 9 and above must use secure URLs.
        3. In iOS (not Android), when go external URL and isUseExtBrowser is true, the application will be turn into background and released after seconds. In future, it maybe keep alive in background.
        Parameters:
        url -
        isUseExtBrowser - true : use system web browser to open URL; false : the URL will be opened in client application and still keep foreground.
        Since:
        7.7

      • goMlet

        public final void goMlet(Mlet toMlet,
          java.lang.String targetOfMlet,
          boolean isAutoReleaseCurrentMlet)
        go and open a Mlet or HTMLMlet (which is probably created by ProjectContext.eval(String)).

        the target of toMlet will be set as targetOfMlet.

        Important :
        if the same name target or form://target is opened, then it will be brought to top.
        for more, see go(String).
        Parameters:
        toMlet -
        targetOfMlet - target of Mlet. The prefix form:// is NOT required.
        isAutoReleaseCurrentMlet - true means the called Mlet will be released after go successfully.
        for more, see setAutoReleaseAfterGo(boolean).
        Since:
        7.7
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.eval(String), go(String)

      • isAutoReleaseAfterGo

        public final boolean isAutoReleaseAfterGo()
        when invoke go(String), this Mlet will be released by server or not.
        Returns:
        true : it will be released after leave and onExit() will be executed by server before releasing;
        false : keep this Mlet alive and user will return back to this Mlet.

        default is false.
        Since:
        7.7
        See Also:
        setAutoReleaseAfterGo(boolean)

      • onExit

        public void onExit()
        the server will invoke this method when exit this Mlet.

        invoke getStatus() in this method will returns STATUS_EXIT.

        Important :
        if there is a running Runnable is started by this Mlet via ProjectContext.run(Runnable), it is a good practice that the running Runnable check getStatus() in loop and finish task when exit.
        Please DON'T to get Thread of it and invoke Thread.stop().
        Since:
        7.0

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        when jump to other form/screen, the server will call onPause() method before enter next form/screen.

        invoke getStatus() in this method will returns STATUS_PAUSE.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        onResume()

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        the server will invoke this method when exit from next form/screen, and enter this Mlet again.

        invoke getStatus() in this method will returns STATUS_RUNNING.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        onPause()

      • onStart

        public void onStart()
        enter this Mlet, server will invoke this method.

        invoke getStatus() in this method will returns STATUS_RUNNING.

        STATUS_INIT is a status before STATUS_RUNNING.
        Since:
        7.0

      • resizeImage

        public static final java.awt.image.BufferedImage resizeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage src,
                                       int to_width,
                                       int to_height)
        resize a BufferedImage to the target size.
        Parameters:
        src -
        to_width -
        to_height -
        Returns:
        the resized image.

      • setAutoReleaseAfterGo

        public final void setAutoReleaseAfterGo(boolean isAutoRelease)
        when invoke go(String), this Mlet will be released by server or not.

        default is false.

        Tip : it is no effect when the URL is script command (for example, cmd://myCmd).
        Parameters:
        isAutoRelease - true : it will be released after leave and onExit() will be executed by server before releasing;
        false : keep this Mlet alive and user will return/back to this Mlet.
        Since:
        7.7
        See Also:
        isAutoReleaseAfterGo(), goMlet(Mlet, String, boolean)
